name: Rose Bouquet
description:
Create a stunning DIY rose bouquet with small and medium crochet roses, matching buds, sepals, and leaves. 
Perfect for gifts or decorations. This pattern is based on a detailed YouTube tutorial, so make sure to follow 
along visually for the best results!

Tip: Mix and match rose sizes and yarn colours for a more dynamic bouquet.
materials: Cotton or acrylic yarn (red, pink, green, etc.)
Floral tape or yarn for wrapping stem
patternSteps:
1. Small Rose:
Foundation chain: Ch 23
Row 1: Skip 3 ch, *3 dc in 4th ch, 1 sc in next ch*, repeat to end
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, *1 dc, 2 dc in same st, 1 dc, ss, ch 1*, repeat
Fasten off

2. Small Bud/Sepal:
Magic ring, ch 1
Rnd 1: 5 sc, ss, ch 1
Rnd 2: 2 sc in each st (10), ss, ch 1
Rnd 3: 1 sc in each st (10), ss
Rnd 4: *ch 5, skip 1, ss in next 2, 1 sc, 1 hdc, skip 1, ss*, repeat 5 times
Fasten off

3. Medium Rose:
Foundation chain: Ch 47
Row 1: Skip 1, 1 hdc in each ch (46)
Row 2: Ch 5, turn, 1 dc in first st, *skip 2, (1 dc + ch 3 + 1 dc) in 3rd st*, repeat
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, *7 dc in ch-3 space, 1 sc in triangle*, end with 7 dc, 1 sc, ss
Fasten off

4. Medium Bud/Sepal:
Magic ring, ch 2
Rnd 1: 6 dc in ring, ss
Rnd 2: *Ch 7, skip 1, 1 ss, 1 sc, 1 hdc, 1 dc in next 2 sts, 1 tc, ss in next st*, repeat 5 times
Fasten off

5. Leaves:
Ch 10, insert thin wire through 10th ch, fold in half
First side: Skip 1 ch, 1 sc, 1 hdc, 1 dc in next 5, 1 hdc, 3 sc in same stitch (turn)
Second side: 1 hdc, 1 dc in next 5, 1 hdc, 1 sc, ss
Fasten off

6. Assembling the Roses:
Step 1: Glue one side of rose to stem, wrap it around, gluing bottom edges
Step 2: Slide leaf/sepal onto stem, glue middle of leaves to bottom
Step 3: Wrap stem with yarn/floral tape, add leaves while wrapping down
Optional: Mix sizes and colors to create a full bouquet

name: Beginner's Basic Sweater
description: This is a straight-forward and basic knitting pattern for a sweater made out of four panels (two sleeves, and identical front and back panels). Written from a beginner to beginners, with simple step-by-step guidance. Measurements and stitch counts are based on my first sweater, so feel free to adjust as needed.
materials: Yarn of your choice (sweater weight recommended)
Knitting needles appropriate for your yarn size
patternSteps: Measurements:\nFront & Back Panels - Length: 20 inches, Width: 21 inches\nSleeves - Length: 18.5 inches, Width: 12 inches (6 inches when folded)

Front and Back Panels:
1. Make a slip knot and cast on until you have the desired width (64 stitches in this example).
2. Knit rows of the stockinette stitch until the panel reaches the desired length (90 rows here, alternating 1 row knit and 1 row purl).
3. Cast/bind off all stitches, leaving a long tail for sewing the shoulder seams.

Sleeves:
1. Make a slip knot and cast on until you have the desired width (42 stitches in this example).
2. Knit rows of the stockinette stitch until the panel reaches the desired length (80 rows here, alternating 1 row knit and 1 row purl).
3. Cast/bind off all stitches, leaving a tail as long as your sleeve for sewing.
4. Sew the sides of each sleeve together.

Joining Panels:
1. Start sewing the bottom edges of the front and back panels together until you reach the sleeve opening.
2. Attach the sleeves to the armholes, sewing all the way around.
3. Repeat for the other sleeve.
4. Sew the top of the front and back panels together at the shoulders (about 4.5 inches in on both sides).

name: Teddy Bear
description: Crochet a soft and cozy teddy bear with an optional hat, bow, and cherries! ðŸ§¸ This is a no-magic-ring pattern (uses a fake magic ring alternative). Follow the free video tutorial alongside this written pattern for the best results. Perfect as a handmade gift or a cuddly decoration. Share your finished bear with #crochetwithmahum!
materials: Worsted weight yarn (brown/cream for body, color of choice for hat & bow, red for cherries, green for stem)
Optional: safety eyes or black yarn for embroidery
patternSteps:
1. Head:
Rnd 1: 8 sc
Rnd 2: 2 sc in each st (16)
Rnd 3: *1 sc, inc* (24)
Rnd 4: *2 sc, inc* (32)
Rnd 5: *3 sc, inc* (40)
Rnd 6-13: sc around (40)
Rnd 14: *3 sc, dec* (32)
Rnd 15: *2 sc, dec* (24)
Rnd 16: *1 sc, dec* (16)
Rnd 17: dec around (8). Fasten off and stuff.
Face Patch:\nRnd 1: 8 sc\nRnd 2: 2 sc in each st (16). Fasten off, embroider the nose, and sew onto the head.

2. Hat:
Rnd 1: 8 sc
Rnd 2: 2 sc in each st (16)
Rnd 3: *1 sc, inc* (24)
Rnd 4: *2 sc, inc* (32)
Rnd 5: *3 sc, inc* (40)
Rnd 6: *4 sc, inc* (48)
Rnd 7-13: sc around (48)
Rnd 14: *3 sc, dec* (tighter fit)
Rnd 15: sc around. Fasten off.

3. Body:
Rnd 1: 8 sc
Rnd 2: 2 sc in each st (16)
Rnd 3: *1 sc, inc* (24)
Rnd 4: *2 sc, inc* (32)
Rnd 5: *3 sc, inc* (40)
Rnd 6-13: sc around (40)
Rnd 14: *3 sc, dec* (32)
Rnd 15: sc around (32)
Rnd 16: *2 sc, dec* (24). Stuff firmly.

4. Arms (make 2):
Rnd 1: 6 sc
Rnd 2: 2 sc in each st (12)
Rnd 3-8: sc around (12)
Rnd 9: dec around (6)
Rnd 10: sc around (6). Fasten off, lightly stuff.

5. Legs (make 2):
Rnd 1: 8 sc
Rnd 2: 2 sc in each st (16)
Rnd 3-5: sc around (16). Fasten off and stuff.

6. Ears (make 2):
Rnd 1: 8 sc
Rnd 2: 2 sc in each st (16)
Rnd 3: sc around (16). Flatten and sew onto head.

7. Cherries & Bow:
Cherry (make 2): Rnd 1: 6 sc
Rnd 2: *1 sc, inc* (9)
Rnd 3: *1 sc, dec* (6). Fasten off and close.
Stem: Ch 70+, fasten off. Sew cherries to ends and tie around bear as a bow.
